page.title: 03THE WRECK
page.content: On a suuny June afternoon on a deserted beach by Marine Park Gardens, we went to have a close look at 'The Wreck'. This is a large concrete slab, 20 x 5 metres, with a hole in the middle. It should have been used during World War II as part of a { {Mulberry Harbour.}As there were no harbours they could use, the Allies floated artificial harbours made of concrete across the channel and sank them off the French coast. The wreck is part of a slab that was broken off in a storm whilst waiting to be towed to France. There is a larger piece in the sea off Pagham beach, which people swim out to. The wreck looks as though it is the skeleton of a dinosaur or the wreck of an ordinary ship with the ribs showing.
